page.title: 03Transport Shapwick Village
page.content: Round here there are not many buses. For instance,in{Shapwick}there are only two public buses per day,one at 10.20a.m. and one at 3.05p.m.Also there are private buses taking people to school,work,college and the army. Altogether there are twelve private buses. People at school have a choice of transport to school, they can either go by bike,bus or car.The local children either walk or go by bike.A bike is a two wheeled vehicle powered by pedals.It is not electric! There are no taxi services in Shapwick,but they do take people to the{Shapwick Hotel.}No lorries over 30 tons are allowed in Shapwick, for they might crack the road.Many of the farmers in Shapwick use modern farm vehicles, like tractors and combine harvesters to help them with their work in the fields.
